page.title: 08Courtaulds
page.content: Courtaulds is famous in industry for textiles. Its chimney which is part of Coventry's landscape took 18 months to build in 1923. Mr. Seal came to our school to talk about it. He explained that it was built of different coloured bricks because that was fashionable then. The chimney which was damaged in World War II is the biggest in England. It was built to preserve the ecology of the area by getting rid of the horrible fumes and stopping pollution. The fumes were coming from the fabric that was being made . The chimney was not sooty because it was not used for burning coal. It was to improve health. Altogether there were 917,000 bricks used. The normal house brick was used for the base and that used 604,500 but the rest of the chimney was different and that used 312,500.
